entry.title: Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (18)
entry.content:
Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (18)20150922
I played for a long time today and finished the game.

I explored the second half of the Nightmare of Mensis and did
everything there. I had a lot of trouble with the Brain Trust
enemies and the Maneater Pigs. Eventually I got around the Pigs by
sneaking through the waterway to their left. I found the boss of
the area to be very fun and a little challenging. I whacked it
with Bolt Paper and was pretty careful. The hardest part was when
it made the purple fog and summoned a clone. I had a hard time
switching out of my great-sword mode so I could do a quick swipe
on the clone.

After that I got the Umbilical Cord from Arianna and fought
Gehrman. I found him to be very challenging. I had to grind a
little every few attempts to have enough Blood Vials. But the last
time I fought him, I only had 17 and didn't use very many. The key
was learning when to try for a Visceral Strike and when to be
aggressive. I also used Bolt Paper on him right before he
transformed so I could get a ton of damage on him during his
transformation. That worked out really well.

I beat the Moon Presence on the second try after adjusting my
runes and being a little bit more careful. I also used Bolt Paper.

I really enjoyed this game. I felt like the combat was much more
tense and the environment much more creepy than the Souls games. I
found myself using items a lot more than in a Souls game. For
instance, by the end of a Souls game I have basically never used
any of the weapon buffs, but in this I used them a lot. I think it
was because I had no other use for Insight and it was a resource
that couldn't really be taken away, so I bought lots of supplies
like that.

My final stats were as follows:
Level: 94
Vitality: 30
Endurance: 40
Strength: 36
Skill: 25
Bloodtinge: 7
Arcane: 6

I used Ludwig's Holy Blade and upgraded it to +10 and had on the
two +18% and then a +12% (I think) gems, so its final attack power
was 580.

Total time: 35:14
  • Video Games
  • Bloodborne
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (17)
entry.content:
Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (17)20150921
I was overly optimistic about how much time I could play today. I
went for about two hours and just beat the next boss (the Micolash
guy in the library). The Frenzy infecting the area made it very
hard because I had to be extra careful. The boss was annoying, but
when I realized I just needed to be very aggressive, I beat it on
the second try.

Total time: 32:22

  • PS4

entry.title: Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (16)
entry.content:
Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (16)20150920
I did all of Yahar'gul, which was very tense because of the Chime
Maidens. I died on my first attack on the One Reborn, but beat it
the next time very quickly. I hid in the stairwell and went out to
do an attack or two. When I was at about 50% health, I used a Bolt
Paper and destroyed it. After that I went to the Orphanage, which
was very tense also because of the Brain Suckers. I beat the
Celestial Emissary on the first try and wasted a Bolt Paper on
it. After that I tried many many time to beat Ebrietas, but kept
dying. Eventually I finally did it by drastically changing my
armor setup, going with the untransformed Holy Blade, and goading
it into the entry hallway so it wouldn't have as much
maneuverability. This was one of the hardest fights I've had so
far. After that I explored the rest of the Lecture Building and
entered the last Nightmare. I think I may be able to beat the game
tomorrow when I play.

Total time: 30:34
  • Video Games
  • Bloodborne
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (15)
entry.content:
Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (15)20150919
I did all of Bygernwerth, although it was really short so that
isn't saying much. I defeated Rom on my second try and mainly
focused on carefully killing off spiders then going in for charged
R2 attacks with Ludwig's Holy Blade. It was fairly easy. After
that I killed Master Willem and then finished Eileen's quest. For
that hunter, I cheesed him by getting him to poison himself and
carefully dodge in and out. I see the end of the game in sight!

Total time: 26:59
  • Video Games
  • Bloodborne
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (14)
entry.content:
Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (14)20150916
I played for about two hours and went through all of Cainhurst
Castle. I found the weird spider monsters outside to be really
challenging, but all the monsters inside were really easy. I went
back to the Dream at the shortcut point to restock. I beat the
boss after about four tries. I started trying to be very careful
but it didn't work well. In the last time, I was really aggressive
and did lots of stunning and visceral attacks. Each visceral
attack did over 1000 damage, which was pretty awesome. After I did
that, I finished Alfred's Quest line and got those two Runes.

Total time: 25:31
  • Video Games
  • Bloodborne
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Book: His Majesty's Dragon, by Naomi Novik (2006) (3)
entry.content:
Book: His Majesty's Dragon, by Naomi Novik (2006) (3)20150916
I finished this book today. I love the idea of Napoleon going
across the Channel with flying airships. I really liked how
Temeraire was so useful there at the end. It was an organic way to
make him "the one" without being incredibly "Mary Sue" about
it. I'm excited for future books.
  • Books
  • 2006
